Key Match Events: Pakistan collapsed from 155-2 to 191 all out after losing 8 wickets in 12 overs.
India won by seven wickets with 20 overs remaining.
Rohit Sharma scored 86 off 63 balls, including six sixes.
Shreyas Iyer contributed with 53 runs after Kohli's wicket.
Mohammed Siraj dismissed Babar Azam for 50, catalyzing Pakistan's collapse.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma praised the bowlers for setting up the win and emphasized team balance.
Babar Azam acknowledged Pakistan's collapse and issues with the new ball.
Waqar Younis criticized Pakistan's batting and noted the need for improvements.
Carlos Brathwaite highlighted India's dominance and skill sets.
Mickey Arthur, Pakistan's coach, looked forward to future matches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was one-sided and lacked the expected hype.
India's bowlers dominated, with notable performances from Bumrah and Siraj.
Pakistan's top-four batters made starts but failed to capitalize.
The game ended with a handshake and fireworks, symbolizing the result.
Others: The match was part of the World Cup 2023, with India aiming to extend their winning streak.
